marc_liberation.title: Change all locations to requestable true

comments.body:
To get the request button in organgelight for every item:

On Thursday Morning to make this live we will need to ssh to deploy@bibdata1 and run
```
cd /opt/marc_liberation/current
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails c
Locations::HoldingLocation.where(requestable:false).each{|hl| hl.requestable = true; hl.save}
```

ssh deploy@catalog-boxes and run
```
cd /opt/orange_light/current
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails c
Rails.cache.clear
```

We have already tested the above changes on bibdata-staging1 and orangelight-staging1
^see https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/issues/1969

orangelight.title: Call numbers time out when they go through the LB
Call numbers issues because of the load balancer

comments.body:
This is a known error we had in the past. One workaround that @tampakis introduced was to have the task running against a specific solr box (lib-solr3 in the past) and not through the load balancer. The problem was that the task was taking to much time to pull the data from solr and nginx was timing out. We also found out that `lib-pulindexer1` was very slow. @kayiwa reprovisioned the box and `lib-pulindexer1` was back on speed. 
Another thing to consider for this error is that an indexing process was triggered at the same to fix the cjk.
When the indexing finishes I will trigger this task again to fix the missing call numbers and will close this issue.

orangelight.title: Temporarily Disable Request Button on Show Page

comments.body:
To remove request button in organgelight for every item:

ssh to deploy@bibdata1 and run
```
cd /opt/marc_liberation/current
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails c
Locations::HoldingLocation.where(requestable:true).each{|hl| hl.requestable = false; hl.save}
```
ssh deploy@catalog-boxes and run
```
cd /opt/orangelight/current
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails c
Rails.cache.clear
```
We have already tested the above changes on bibdata-staging1 and orangelight-staging1

Here are all the ones that are currently true:

["anxa", "anxadoc", "anxafst", "l", "p", "res", "sct", "sdt", "set", "sht", "spt", "srt", "stlo", "t", "anxb", "anxbl", "anxbnc", "ned", "hygf", "new", "sci", "sciefa", "scilaf", "sciref", "sciresp", "sciss", "scith", "sarp", "sat", "mlis", "other", "ppl", "pplt", "hsvc", "hsve", "hsvg", "hsvm", "hsvn", "hsvp", "hsvr", "pres", "rcpgp", "rcpjq", "rcppa", "rcppb", "rcppe", "rcppf", "rcppg", "rcpph", "rcppj", "rcppk", "rcppl", "rcppm", "rcppn", "rcppq", "rcpps", "rcppt", "rcppw", "rcppz", "rcpqb", "rcpqk", "rcpql", "rcpqv", "rcpqx", "rcpxc", "rcpxg", "rcpxm", "rcpxn", "rcpxp", "rcpxr", "rcpxx", "sprf", "pplnb", "scsbcul", "scsbnypl", "rcpxw", "hsvw", "fac", "gss"]
Requests are not being accepted until at least 4/6 including Borrow Direct and Interlibrary Loan services.

pulfalight.title: Shopping Cart feature set for supporting the selection of multiple containers for Aeon requests

comments.body:
Jotting down a few thoughts here... 

According to [the Vue.JS cookbook](https://vuejs.org/v2/cookbook/client-side-storage.html), it seems like using client-side storage (specifically, LocalStorage) will be the best way to track requested items over the course of a session.

Mozilla and Chrome [implement this slightly different](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9948284/how-persistent-is-localstorage). Mozilla treats LocalStorage as Cookies and Chrome treats it as cache, the life expectancy/deletion of both however are in the hands of the user.

comments.body:
- [x] Change Pickup Location to always be Firestone instead of Lewis `Pickup location: Lewis Library` (https://catalog.princeton.edu/requests/10133617?mfhd=9924175&source=pulsearch)
- [x] Change the delivery option `Pageable item at Lewis Library, will be delivered to Lewis Library Service desk on first floor.` To be `Pageable item at Lewis Library. Request for delivery in 1-2 business days.` (https://catalog.princeton.edu/requests/10133617?mfhd=9924175&source=pulsearch)

- [x] Change the email confirmation to say that it is going to be picked up in Firestone
- [x] Question for Peter Bae: `Items requested before 3:00 pm (weekdays and weekends) will be available for pickup, on the same day` Is this still true?  What is the new delivery expectations?
- [x] For items that are not currently in Lewis and are Circulating we need to make the `Request this item` button show up For example: https://catalog-staging.princeton.edu/requests/3193478?mfhd=3511881&source=pulsearch

- [x] Make sure the email request goes to both the branch location (location of book) and the firestone circulation desk. 

- [x] Make sure Firestone Library only gets one email
- [ ] Check with Peter Bae to confirm "Pageable item at Engineering Library. Request for delivery in 1-2 business days."  Is 1-2 days really what is going to happen?
